returnStdout.documentation: Return standard output instead of exit code

returnStatus.documentation: Return exit code instead of throwing exception on non-zero

label.documentation: Label for this step in Blue Ocean

sh.documentation: Execute a shell script. On Unix-like systems, this runs the script using /bin/sh.

returnStdout.documentation: Return standard output instead of exit code

returnStatus.documentation: Return exit code instead of throwing exception on non-zero

returnStdout.documentation: Return standard output instead of exit code

returnStatus.documentation: Return exit code instead of throwing exception on non-zero

echo.documentation: Print a message to the build log.

error.documentation: Signal an error and fail the build.

message.documentation: Message explaining why the build is unstable

unstable.documentation: Mark the build as unstable with a message.

warnError.documentation: Catch errors and mark build as unstable instead of failing.

name.documentation: Name of the stage for visualization in the pipeline view

stage.documentation: Define a stage in the pipeline. Stages provide logical grouping and can be visualized in the Blue Ocean interface and the classic pipeline stage view.

label.documentation: Label expression to select the node (agent) to run on

node.documentation: Allocate a node (agent/executor) to run the enclosed steps. The node provides a workspace on the agent machine.

resource.documentation: Name of the resource to lock

label.documentation: Label of the resource to lock

inversePrecedence.documentation: If true, newer builds get priority

lock.documentation: Acquire a lock on a shared resource for exclusive access. Prevents concurrent builds from using the same resource.

parallel.documentation: Execute multiple branches in parallel. Each branch runs concurrently on available executors.

script.documentation: Execute a block of scripted pipeline code within a declarative pipeline. Allows using Groovy code inside declarative syntax.

checkout.documentation: Check out source code from SCM. Supports Git, Subversion, Mercurial and other SCM systems.

git.documentation: Checkout from a Git repository. Simplified syntax for the checkout step with Git SCM.

artifacts.documentation: Ant-style pattern of files to archive (e.g., '**/target/*.jar')

allowEmptyArchive.documentation: If true, don't fail if no files match

onlyIfSuccessful.documentation: Only archive if build is successful

archiveArtifacts.documentation: Archive build artifacts for later retrieval. Artifacts are stored on the Jenkins master and can be downloaded from the build page.

testResults.documentation: Ant-style pattern for JUnit XML test results (e.g., '**/target/surefire-reports/*.xml')

allowEmptyResults.documentation: If true, don't fail if no test results

junit.documentation: Publish JUnit test results. Parses XML test reports and displays them in the build page.

name.documentation: Name of the stash for later retrieval

includes.documentation: Ant-style pattern of files to include

excludes.documentation: Ant-style pattern of files to exclude

stash.documentation: Stash files for use later in the same build. Stashed files can be retrieved on a different node using unstash.

name.documentation: Name of the stash to retrieve

unstash.documentation: Restore files previously stashed. Retrieves files from a named stash into the current workspace.

message.documentation: Message to display to the user

submitter.documentation: Comma-separated list of users/groups who can approve

submitterParameter.documentation: Environment variable to store the submitter's ID

input.documentation: Pause the pipeline for human input. The build waits until someone clicks the proceed button.

unit.documentation: Time unit: NANOSECONDS, MICROSECONDS, MILLISECONDS, SECONDS, MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS

timeout.documentation: Set a timeout for the enclosed steps. If the timeout is exceeded, the build is aborted.

retry.documentation: Retry the enclosed steps if they fail. Useful for flaky operations.

unit.documentation: Time unit: NANOSECONDS, MICROSECONDS, MILLISECONDS, SECONDS, MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS

sleep.documentation: Pause the pipeline for a specified duration.

buildResult.documentation: Build result on error: SUCCESS, UNSTABLE, FAILURE, NOT_BUILT, ABORTED

catchError.documentation: Catch errors in the enclosed steps and set the build/stage result instead of failing.

overrides.documentation: List of environment variables in KEY=VALUE format

withEnv.documentation: Set environment variables for the enclosed steps. Variables are restored after the block.

withCredentials.documentation: Bind credentials to environment variables for the enclosed steps. Credentials are masked in logs.

path.documentation: Directory path (relative to workspace or absolute)

dir.documentation: Change the current directory for the enclosed steps.

deleteDir.documentation: Delete the current directory and its contents. Typically used to clean the workspace.

writeFile.documentation: Write content to a file in the workspace.

readFile.documentation: Read content from a file in the workspace.

fileExists.documentation: Check if a file exists in the workspace. Returns true or false.

isUnix.documentation: Check if running on a Unix-like system. Returns true for Linux/macOS, false for Windows.

tmp.documentation: Return the temporary directory instead of workspace

pwd.documentation: Get the current working directory path.

properties.documentation: Set job properties declaratively. Used to configure build triggers, parameters, and other job settings.

job.documentation: Name of the job to build

parameters.documentation: Parameters to pass to the job

wait.documentation: Wait for the build to complete

quietPeriod.documentation: Seconds to wait before starting the build

build.documentation: Trigger another job and optionally wait for it to complete.

emailext.documentation: Send an email notification with extended options.

cleanWs.documentation: Clean the workspace. More flexible than deleteDir with pattern support.

timestamps.documentation: Add timestamps to console output for the enclosed steps.

colorMapName.documentation: Color map name: xterm, vga, css, gnome-terminal

ansiColor.documentation: Enable ANSI color output in the console for the enclosed steps.

sshagent.documentation: Provide SSH credentials for the enclosed steps via ssh-agent.

wrap.documentation: Execute a build wrapper. Used internally by other wrapper steps.

env.documentation: Environment variables available in the build. Access with env.VARIABLE_NAME or env['VARIABLE_NAME']. Contains both Jenkins-defined and custom environment variables.

params.documentation: Build parameters defined in the pipeline. Access with params.PARAM_NAME. Read-only map of parameter names to values.

currentBuild.documentation: Information about the current build. Properties include: number, result, currentResult, displayName, description, duration, startTimeInMillis, etc.

scm.documentation: The SCM configuration for the current build. Available when using Multibranch Pipeline or Pipeline from SCM.

docker.documentation: Docker integration object. Provides methods: image(), build(), withRegistry(), withServer(), withTool().

pipeline.documentation: Reference to the pipeline script object. Rarely needed directly.
